tests.name: Pre-Preliminary Skating Skills
elements: Forward right and left foot spirals
tests.notes: Formerly Pre-Preliminary Moves in the Field. Basic edge quality, posture, and control emphasized.

tests.name: Preliminary Skating Skills
tests.notes: Focus on power generation, clean edges, and controlled turns.

tests.name: Pre-Bronze Skating Skills
tests.notes: Introduces more advanced power generation and turn control.

tests.name: Bronze Skating Skills
elements: Forward and backward power change of edge pulls
tests.notes: Requires stronger edge control and mastery of brackets.

tests.name: Pre-Silver Skating Skills
tests.notes: Introduces rockers and counters with power and flow.

tests.name: Silver Skating Skills
elements: Field move sequence (spirals, spread eagles, Ina Bauers)
tests.notes: Requires mastery of multi-turn sequences and strong body alignment.

tests.name: Pre-Gold Skating Skills
tests.notes: High-level edge control and multi-turn sequences required.

tests.name: Gold Skating Skills
elements: Back outside power double threes → power double inside rockers
Back inside power double threes → power double outside rockers
tests.notes: Highest level of Skating Skills (formerly Senior Moves in the Field). Requires exceptional edge quality, power, and control.

tests.name: Pre-Preliminary Free Skate
elements: Jumps: Waltz jump, half jumps, single jumps (no axel required)
Spins: Two spins in any position (minimum 3 revolutions each)
Step sequence: One step sequence using full ice
Restrictions: No axel or double jumps permitted
tests.notes: Introductory free skate program demonstrating basic jump/spin control.

tests.name: Preliminary Free Skate
elements: Jumps: Single jumps allowed; axel optional
Combinations: One jump combination or sequence
Spins: Two spins (minimum 3 revolutions), one may be a combination spin
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: Focus on clean single jumps and basic spin variety.

tests.name: Pre-Bronze Free Skate
elements: Jumps: All single jumps permitted, including axel
Combinations: One jump combination and one jump sequence
Spins: Two spins (minimum 4 revolutions), one may be a combination spin
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: Axel is allowed but not required; quality and control emphasized.

tests.name: Bronze Free Skate
elements: Jumps: All single jumps permitted, including axel
Combinations: Up to two jump combinations or sequences
Spins: Three spins (minimum 4 revolutions), one must be a combination spin
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: Highest level before double jumps are introduced.

tests.name: Pre-Silver Free Skate
elements: Jumps: Single jumps and axel required; double salchow and double toe loop permitted
Combinations: Up to two jump combinations or sequences
Spins: Three spins (minimum 4 revolutions), one must be a combination spin
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
Restrictions: No double jumps other than 2S or 2T
tests.notes: First level where double jumps may appear.

tests.name: Silver Free Skate
elements: Jumps: All single jumps and axel required; double jumps permitted except 2A
Combinations: Up to two jump combinations or sequences
Spins: Three spins (minimum 4 revolutions), one must be a combination spin
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
Restrictions: No double axel or triples
tests.notes: Introduces more advanced double jumps and spin difficulty.

tests.name: Pre-Gold Free Skate
elements: Jumps: All single jumps and double jumps permitted except 2A optional
Combinations: Up to two jump combinations or sequences
Spins: Three spins with increased difficulty (minimum 5 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: High-level double jump proficiency expected.

tests.name: Gold Free Skate
elements: Jumps: All single and double jumps permitted; double axel optional
Combinations: Up to two jump combinations or sequences
Spins: Three spins with advanced positions (minimum 5 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: Highest level of Free Skate testing; strong skating skills and double jumps required.

tests.name: Solo Free Dance – Bronze
elements: 1 solo dance spin (minimum 3 revolutions; no flying entry)
1 step sequence (circular, midline, or diagonal; must include 3-turns and mohawks)
tests.notes: Introductory level of Solo Free Dance. Focus on musicality, basic edge quality, and clean execution of required elements.

tests.name: Solo Free Dance – Pre-Silver
elements: 1 solo dance spin (minimum 3 revolutions; no flying entry)
1 step sequence (circular, midline, or diagonal; must include 3-turns, mohawks, and brackets)
1 twizzle series (minimum 1 revolution on each foot; different entry edge or direction)
tests.notes: Introduces twizzle series and more complex step sequence requirements.

tests.name: Solo Free Dance – Silver
elements: 2 short edge elements (each 3–7 seconds; must be in different positions)
1 solo dance spin (minimum 3 revolutions; no flying entry)
1 step sequence (circular, midline, or diagonal; must include 3-turns, mohawks, and brackets)
1 twizzle series (minimum 1 revolution on each foot; different entry edge or direction)
tests.notes: Requires two short edge elements and more advanced turn variety in the step sequence.

tests.name: Solo Free Dance – Pre-Gold
elements: Combo edge element + short edge element OR 3 short edge elements (each 3–7 seconds; combo ≤12 seconds total)
1 solo dance spin (minimum 3 revolutions; no flying entry)
1 step sequence including rockers, counters, and choctaws
tests.notes: First level requiring rockers, counters, and choctaws in the step sequence.

tests.name: Solo Free Dance – Gold
elements: Combo edge element + short edge element OR 3 short edge elements (3–7 seconds each; combo ≤12 seconds total)
1 solo dance spin (minimum 3 revolutions; no flying entry)
1 step sequence including rockers, choctaws, and twizzles
1 twizzle series (multi-rev, multi-directional, or complex entry)
tests.notes: Highest level of Solo Free Dance. Requires mastery of advanced turns, musical interpretation, and strong edge control.

tests.name: Preliminary Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Introductory pattern dances focusing on basic timing, edges, and pattern accuracy.

tests.name: Pre-Bronze Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Introduces more complex timing and introductory partnering skills.

tests.name: Bronze Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Requires stronger edge control and more precise pattern placement.

tests.name: Pre-Silver Pattern Dance
tests.notes: First level with more demanding partnering holds and deeper edges.

tests.name: Silver Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Requires strong unison, deeper edges, and more complex timing.

tests.name: Pre-Gold Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Dances introduce more advanced partnering, power, and expression.

tests.name: Gold Pattern Dance
tests.notes: Highest domestic pattern dance level; requires exceptional edge quality and partnering.

tests.name: International Pattern Dance
tests.notes: International dances follow ISU rules; highest difficulty in timing, partnering, and edge control.

tests.name: Bronze Pairs
elements: Side-by-side jumps: Single jumps only (no axel required)
Throw jumps: Single throw jump permitted
Lifts: One lift (waist-level only; no one-arm holds)
Pair spin: One pair spin (minimum 3 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
Restrictions: No overhead lifts, no death spirals, no double jumps
tests.notes: Introductory pairs level focusing on unison, timing, and basic pair elements.

tests.name: Pre-Silver Pairs
elements: Side-by-side jumps: Single jumps including axel permitted
Throw jumps: Single throw jumps permitted
Lifts: One lift (waist or shoulder level; no one-arm holds)
Pair spin: One pair spin (minimum 3 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
Restrictions: No overhead lifts, no death spirals, no double jumps
tests.notes: Introduces more advanced lifts and allows axel jumps.

tests.name: Silver Pairs
elements: Side-by-side jumps: Single jumps including axel required; double salchow and double toe loop permitted
Throw jumps: Single throw jumps required; double throw jumps permitted
Lifts: One overhead lift permitted (no difficult variations)
Pair spin: One pair spin (minimum 4 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: First level allowing overhead lifts and double jumps.

tests.name: Pre-Gold Pairs
elements: Side-by-side jumps: Single jumps and selected double jumps permitted (no 2A)
Throw jumps: Single and double throw jumps permitted
Lifts: One overhead lift with variations permitted
Pair spin: One pair spin with advanced positions (minimum 4 revolutions)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
Restrictions: No triple jumps, no death spirals
tests.notes: Higher difficulty in lifts and throws; strong unison expected.

tests.name: Gold Pairs
elements: Side-by-side jumps: All single and double jumps permitted; double axel optional
Throw jumps: Single and double throw jumps permitted
Lifts: One overhead lift with advanced variations
Pair spin: One pair spin with advanced positions (minimum 5 revolutions)
Death spiral: One death spiral (any permitted entry)
Step sequence: One choreographic step sequence
tests.notes: Highest domestic pairs test level; requires strong pair unison, advanced lifts, and clean execution.
